threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

trid.file_type: file seems to be plain text/ASCII

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects when adversaries stop services or processes by disabling their respective scheduled tasks in order to conduct data destructive activities

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Disable Windows Defender Functionalities Via Registry Keys
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects when attackers or tools disable Windows Defender functionalities via the Windows registry
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: AlertIQ, Ján Trencanský, frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel

match_context.values: @{RuleName=T1089,Tamper-Defender; Details=DWORD (0x00000001); EventType=SetValue; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\reg.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\DisableAntiSpyware}

@{RuleName=T1089,Tamper-Defender; EventType=SetValue; Details=DWORD (0x00000001); Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\reg.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\DisableAntiVirus}

@{RuleName=T1089,Tamper-Defender; EventID=13; EventType=SetValue; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\reg.exe; Details=DWORD (0x00000001); TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Real-Time Protection\DisableRealtimeMonitoring}

@{RuleName=T1089,Tamper-Defender; Details=DWORD (0x00000000); EventType=SetValue; Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\reg.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\SpyNet\SpynetReporting}

@{RuleName=T1089,Tamper-Defender; EventType=SetValue; Details=DWORD (0x00000000); Image=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\reg.exe; EventID=13; TargetObject=HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\SpyNet\SubmitSamplesConsent}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects when an attacker or tool disables the  Windows Defender service (WinDefend) via the registry
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Ján Trencanský, frack113, AlertIQ, Nasreddine Bencherchali

match_context.values: @{Details=DWORD (0x00000004); EventID=13; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventType=SetValue; TargetObject=HKLM\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\WinDefend\Start}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

attributes.magic: ASCII text, with CRLF line terminators

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert icmp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Unusual PING detected"; icode:0; itype:8; fragbits:!M; content:!"ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWABCDEFGHI",depth 32; content:!"0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuv",depth 32; content:!"EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE",depth 36; content:!"WANG2"; content:!"cacti-monitoring-system",depth 65; content:!"SolarWinds",depth 72; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop,ruleset community; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-closer-look-at-the-target-malware-part-ii/; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-first-look-at-the-target-intrusion-malware/; classtype:successful-recon-limited; sid:29456; rev:3; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING Windows"; itype:8; content:"abcdefghijklmnop",depth 16; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:382; rev:11; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP PING"; icode:0; itype:8; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:384; rev:8; )
alert icmp $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Echo Reply"; icode:0; itype:0; metadata:ruleset community; classtype:misc-activity; sid:408; rev:8; )

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
This script appears to be designed to disable Microsoft Defender, a security software suite included with Windows 10. It achieves this by modifying various registry keys and settings, as well as disabling or modifying scheduled tasks and services. 

The script begins by disabling Windows Defender's real-time protection and other features, such as behavior monitoring and on-access protection. It then disables logging and various scheduled tasks associated with Windows Defender. 

Next, the script removes the Windows Defender icon from the system tray and disables the context menu option for Windows Defender. It also adds exclusion paths to Windows Defender, effectively preventing it from scanning certain directories. 

Finally, the script disables several Windows Defender services, including the Windows Defender Service, the Windows Defender Network Inspection Service, and the Windows Defender Antivirus Service.
